title: New bus service
text:
NEWSPAPER SECTION: LIFE | WRITER: KARNJANA KARNJANATAWE - + Angkor Mongkol Michai company has launched a new public bus service linking Chong Chom Border checkpoint in Surin to Siem Reap in Cambodia. The distance is about 170km and the travelling time is three hours. 
The company is a joint venture between Thai and Cambodian businessmen and politicians. The service can facilitate travellers between the two countries, according to Sombat Srisurin, the company co-founder and a former Member of Parliament of Surin. "The service is introduced in time for the launch of the Asean Economic Community at the end of this year," he noted. 
The company uses air-conditioned buses with options of 22 and 32 seats. The service is available three times a day at Chong Chom station in Kap Choeng district, 67km south of the city of Surin. The departure time is 8am, 9.30am and 3pm. 
The return trip from Siem Reap bus station is also available three times a day at 5am, 6am and 2pm. A one-way ticket fare is 350 baht. Mobile charging stations 
Chiang Mai International airport has launched four battery charging stations for passengers to charge their mobile phones without service fee. 
Each outlet has four power sockets, which each features two power outlets and two USB ports, and a wooden tray under the sockets for putting the phones. There are signboards stating "Telephone Charge Only" in Thai, Chinese and English languages although the power sockets can also support laptop chargers. 
Three charging stations are located at the departure hall of the domestic terminal and another one is installed at the departure hall of the international terminal. Direct train to Malaysia 
Keretapi Tanah Melayu Berhad, or Malayan Railways, has introduced daily direct train service between Hat Yai in Thailand and Johor Baru at the southern tip of Malaysia. 
Called Peninsular Express Train, the service is an extension from the existent Hat Yai- Kuala Lumpur Sentral, which is the central train station in the capital of Malaysia, to the south. The new route, which has been available since the beginning of this month, can connect passengers who want to cross to Singapore by train. 
The train stops at 34 stations, except Penang's Bukit Mertajam and Butterworth stations, according to a company statement. 
The service consists of two class; sleeping berth and seat. The one-way ticket fares cost RM82 (about 650 baht) and RM70 (585 baht) respectively. 
The train leaves the station at Hat Yai daily at 5.45pm and the arrival time at Johor Baru Sentral station is 4.25pm the following day. For the trip from Johor Baru, the train leaves its station at 5pm and arrives at Hat Yai at 11.40am. One-way travelling time is almost 20 hours. Visit www.ktmb.com.my or call 1300-88-5862 . Online travel survey 
The Pacific Asia Travel Association (Pata) has launched an online survey to find out the travel interests of young people in the Asia Pacific region. 
Called Stepping out of the Crowd, the survey will ask young travellers about their habits when planning and booking their trips and their attitudes towards visiting less commonly-visited areas such as city suburbs and smaller towns during their vacation. 
The survey is open to participants between the ages of 16-35 in Australia, China, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Japan, Macau, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan, Thailand and Vietnam. Only one entry is accepted per person. 
The survey is available in English, Chinese, Japanese, Korean and Thai. Those who answer the survey will have a chance to win a lucky draw prize, an Apple Watch. The deadline is Oct 30. Visit www.pata.org/young-consumer-travel-survey . Airlines update Eurowings, Lufthansa's long-haul, low-cost carrier, will launch direct flight from Cologne in Germany to Phuket and Bangkok in December. The new intercontinental services will be operated with Airbus A330-200 aircraft. 
The service to Phuket will start on Dec 18 and will be available two times a week on Fridays and Monday. The return trip from Phuket will be available every Saturday and Tuesday. 
For the Cologne to Bangkok flights, the service will start on Dec 20 and will also be available two times a week on Wednesdays and Sundays. The return leg from Bangkok will be available on Thursdays and Mondays. 
In addition, Eurowings will also offer flights from Cologne/Bonn to Dubai, Varadero in Cuba and Punta Cana in the Dominican Republic within the end of this year. 
The airline will have its first two aircraft in November before expanding to seven Airbus A330s in the future. Visit www.eurowings.com . Nok Air will launch direct flights between Bangkok and Hanoi. The service will start on Dec 1 with four fights a week. 
Hanoi will be its second destination in Vietnam after the launch of direct flights to Ho Chi Minh City earlier this year. The service to Hanoi will be operated by Boeing 737-800 with capacity of 189 seats. The departure time from Don Mueang International Airport is 6.20am on Thursdays and Fridays and 6.20pm on Sundays and Mondays. 
The return trips from Hanoi will be available at 9.05am on Thursdays and Fridays and 8.50pm on Sundays and Mondays. The airline will increase the frequency to five times a week with an additional flight on Wednesday on Feb 1. 
To promote the new international flight, the airline offers one-way, all-inclusive fares starting from 999 baht until Sept 20.
